reviewText: The Game has pretty much been summed up in other reviews, but I just want to give a quick insight.  When I first saw this game on steam I thought that it would be a game in a similar vein to Illusion Software's titles, based around the neat-ish concept of Cindrella. I thought it was kind of cool something like this could actually show up on steam (on the front page), as it gives it a greater feel of legitimacy, and I couldn't resist the low price. I saw the R12 rating and done some research, obviously finding about the so called R18" version of the game

reviewText:

Here is my 30 minute preview of the game filled with information, visual candy and laughs.

I came into the game without too much research and expected a hack and slash type game, I was amused however to see it was completely different. For a puzzle game it's a neat concept and plays out well, if you can ignore the fact there is no solid credible story in the middle. You basically launch the game, get put deep in the story from start and then grind your way through puzzles until you reach the ending. Then the story ties up.

Several questions I have seen so far on the community hub are questions such as: Is there nekkidness
date: does she strip? and does she-". Let's just put it this way
recommended: the bondage from this game has been removed but you still see her jigglyness. In the other version you can control her bust size and remove her skirt to get her into a more skimpy dress. Well with changing her into a more skimpy dress you can do it in this version too
hoursPlayed: you have to accumulate money from completing levels which in turn gives you XP and Money. (The level means you get more HP meaning you can survive more traps in the puzzles). I personally really did enjoy the 'eye candy' and it helped me complete the game har-har.\n\nPushing all the fantasy stuff aside
voteText: the game requires you to make it through each levels of the castle and make it to the door to move onto the next level. I found the game to be a very fun and challenging experience
helpfulPercent:
especially when getting to higher levels - Although some levels could be 'cheesed' by standing next to the block of the door to escape. There are around 20 levels I believe from memory and it took me 4 hours to complete the game start to finish. Please do check the video out though as I have difficulties explaining a lot of things.

The only negatives I found is after a while the dungeon still uses the same textures and layouts meaning the areas can look a bit bland.

It took me 4 hours to complete the game - some levels at the end getting more challenging. Some levels you can kind of 'cheat' though.

I would recommend this to most people wanting an enjoyable puzzle game for a very fair price. I would also recommend it to people who enjoy jiggly things. XD

I would avoid this game if you get easily frustrated or just want pure porn only.
I hope you appreciate this review and if there is anything I need to add or any questions

reviewText:
I wish I could give this game more of a neutral rating vs a yes or no type recommendation,  but alas I can't. So, I'll simply leave a positive and let you decide from reviews.

------

This isn't your average Cinderella story. There really isn't much of a story itself for this game. Which I guess is because this game was originally an H-game. The removal of some of that material I belive didn't effect the game at all. So, if you aren't interested in that type of thing then this is the version for you. If you like those type of things I'd advise buying the R18 addition and forget about the Steam version unless you want to further support the devoloper and want Steam achievements. Despite all the hate on this game there is no nudity and honestly not dirty content at all.

Now I previously talked about the story for this game. Its short. Its simple. Its sweet. Yes, I really do wish there was more of a story in this game. Reguardless, I still liked it. Puzzles are also fairly simple and aren't all that hard to complete. You can pretty much finish the game in 3-4 hours unless you want to grind some money for the few outfits this game offers.

Pros:
Silly game overall.
I actually liked the Soundtrack.
Different art style.
Achievements.


Cons:
Very short story.
Camera Controls.
Jumping seemed wonky. (Or it could have just been me)


------

I notice theres been a lot of hate going on around in the reviews due to the nature this game originally came from. If I see any rude comments I will delete them. I would rather see contructive feedback and questions.

reviewText:
Fantastically quirky short puzzle game. I haven't completed it yet, but I've been longing to play the game since played the demo a few days before the release date.
The game is simplistic, I will not deny that. I also won't deny there are some rather janky mechanics due to the Unity engine allowing you to have a 'cheap' and unintended solution to a level. There is also some jank in the hitboxes of the swinging axes which can be pretty frustrating if you're not thinking and just going by appearance. The levels are rather open ended, so you can solve them multiple different ways.
As many have said before, the game and its story are pretty short, but is novel and unexpected compared to the look of the game. The levels for the most part look the same and you'll probably end up well accustomed to the textures of walls and blocks, and the model of Cinderella herself (which looks alright in my opinion)
There are a couple of customisation options in this version, not as many as the R-18 version you can purchase, but honestly, for such a game I wouldn't really worry too much about not having a skirt disable feature or jiggle physics slider- if this is something that you can't live without then I guess you should get the R-18 one, but this is basically the same game.
So the game is what it is. For a £3-4 game, you can't really say you're not getting what you're paying for. The game works, and works well enough to be an enjoyable experience for anyone who isn't frustrated at puzzle games yet and wishes to sit there pondering the  next course of action!

reviewText:
Cinderella Escape is a block puzzle game with 3D graphics. Your main goal in this game is trying to solve the puzzle to allow escape from current level.
The game story a bit new variant of a original cinderella, she saw that when Prince murdered a King, Prince noticed that and after this she and her whole family been thrown to the dungeon. When you escaping you have choice to save your stepmother and two sisters. All this completed in a anime style.
The gameplay is enough simple, you should escape from stages, for this you have a different ways. For escaping you have two limited resources, the jumping and kicking. After all stage you got a experience points, your level is growing and thanks for it you HP to. The controls in a game enough good, a camera view you can change, but sometimes its not help too much .
Sounds are enough good, and game music also nice. The graphic is not bad, Cinderella looks good, environment a bit simple but fit for purpose.

So my verdict

+nice music
+some moral choices
+different way to escape
+steam achievements

-no trading cards
-a camera views sometimes not a best
-a bit short

So i think if you like a lightsome puzzles, want check a one new variant of the original Cinderella story what confirmed in anime style, or want a rest a bit, I recommend this game for you. The game price is enough fair, so this cant be problem fro you, but if its get a bigger discount really can be must buy.

8/10

reviewText:
Cinderella Escape is a block puzzle game with 3D graphics.

You control Cinderella who tries to escape from the dungeon she'd been thrown to because she saw the King was murdered by the Prince (a little twist of the story).

The main goal is to find the exit door of each room during forty stages.

You can push blocks, jump over them or even destroy them with your kick in a 3d enviroment avoiding some dangers (saws, pikes, blades...).

Some stages have multiple ways to get to the goal and you must plan every move using zoom out key because you have limited kicks and jumps per level and this fact is the main difficulty of the game.

You can earn experience points when you complete levels and increse the number of them.

You can also unblock costumes and change her look during the game.

You can move her using WASD keys, kick and jump using mouse buttons and move the position of the camera using the mouse.

Graphics are correct (Cinderella is detailed modeled), but the rest of objects are simply and their textures very repetitive. Ok, you are in a dungeon but more variety of them will be nice.

Sound and music are correct too.

It has achivements but it's not trading cards, I encourage to developers to add them in next releases.

Nice puzzle game to play a couple of hours.

PD: Thanks to Shade00

reviewText:
Cinderella Escape is a block puzzle game with 3D graphics. Don't let the name fool you: You wouldn't want to gift this game to your 7 year old cousin.

Gameplay:You control Cinderella who tries to escape a dungeon she'd been thrown to. Along the way you can save your two mean sisters and a stepmother, or you can leave them to rot and possibly die of starvation.  They were mean to you, okay?  They deserve it.   Most stages have multiple ways to get to the goal.
You can push blocks, jump over them or even destroy them with your Falcon Kick, though you have limited jumps and kicks per level.You can expand you limit by earning experience (that you earn by completing levels) and leveling up.

Graphics: Simple and neat. Not much to say about them since you're pushing the same blocks in the same dungeon over and over again, but I found them nice to look at, for what they are.

Sound: Again, I don't have much to say. The only sounds you will hear are the same music that plays in all stages, moanings of Cinderella when she loses health or kicks blocks, and her footsteps. Music sounds kind of sinister and is very fitting to a dungeon. Even though it plays on loop, my fluffy ears are still in one piece. Cinderella's grunts of pain are your typical japanese  Ouch! I broke my fingernail"  grunts
date: and her footsteps sound like... well
recommended: normal footsteps.\nI'm kinda dragging the subject here
hoursPlayed: let's move on...\n\nControls: You use WASD to control Cinderella

votesTotal: Mouse Wheel to zoom in/out. It works. You can zoom out to plan your moves
votesFunny: and zoom in to pass the platforming moments.\n\nConclusion:If you're a big fan of puzzle games and you're looking for a challenge

reviewText:
FULL DISCLOSURE: Key provided by developer.

If you've ever had the misfortune to sit through softcore porn on terrestrial TV, you'll more often than not find that all the sex scenes (or, y'know, cleverly angled dry humping scenes) have been cast out leaving you with a near-unwatchable drama about a lawyer that becomes a stripper to take down a cabal of corrupt lesbian cops or some other nonsense that only makes sense when the cast get busy at five minute intervals.
As an R12 hentai game, CINDERELLA ESCAPE manages to avoid being as completely pointless as the dry run of BUSTY LAWYER 3: INTERNAL AFFAIRS was, building its gameplay around escaping a dungeon by pushing, smashing and jumping on innumerable concrete blocks, but is plagued by mind numbing repetitiveness and frustrating controls that sell your jumps short and saddle your kicks with the power of a metal donkey, wiping out blocks you need at random.
There is, of course, a patch available to restore the game to its unaltered deviant glory but I couldn't comment on that. I've got a family for god's sake. If torture and ♥♥♥♥ are enough to tide you through a shaky mediocre puzzle game, power to you amigo.

reviewText:
I like it! You get to be a princess and solve puzzels and stuff (just puzzels. Not much stuff). But the game is simple, and simple is good. You're a princes being held captive by an evil king, and rather than playing the character of a knight who goes to rescue her, you play as the princess trying to escape.

Yes. The puzzels are fun, but I think the brilliance behind this game isn't so much in the gameplay, but in the concept and story. In this game, Cinderella is a sweet princess who is horribly treated, and on top of that, has the worst luck when she gets thrown in a dungeon for seeing something she shouldn't have. They make you feel very sorry for her. And I think what's great about the fact that you control her character, rather than playing as a hero trying to save her, is that you really feel like you are helping her escape. Like she has literally no friends in the world, no heros, no allies, but you. It doesn't feel like your playing as her, and that you as a player are the important one, but it feels like you are helping this character escape her horrible life. You, as a player, are the one force in the world who can bring justice to this cruel world the princess inhabits

Sure, there could possibly be some far better puzzel games out there where you play as a dot trying to get passed cubes. But I don't care to see a dot succeed. I must help the princess escape! I'm her only hope!

Most likely none of this crosses your mind when you play the game, but I believe everyone feels it in the back of their minds. I know this was very in depth for a simple puzzel game, but I believe it's all true, and just want to give credit where credit is due. So please buy this game. It's very fun and deserves your support!

reviewText:
This game in phenomenal. I will spend the rest of my days playing this game in my spare time. They say that DOTA 2 and League of Legends consume your life. Clearly they have never played Cinderella Escape! R12.

Speed running this game after you know what to do on each puzzle is one of the most fun things to do in the game. Figuring out the strats and using techniques like R-Stalling and GBoosting is some of the most satisfying pieces of AT in any game. I highly recommend this game to anyone who has a brain and/or soul.

The story is absolutely mindblowing after you get the True Ending, the game leaves you to figure out some of the story for yourself rather than telling you like amateur story telling games. I will not tell you what actually happens since I don't want to actually spoil it for you.

If you have the $3.99 you should buy this game immediately.

reviewText:
When I first saw this I was excited, I've been wanting an escape game featuring a girl, and this was it.

But oh boy, this was nothing that I wanted.

Gameplay: It's a 3D platforming puzzle game.  You push around blocks and break blocks to get through to the door.  There are swinging axes and shooting discs which will hurt.  That's everything.  For the most part it's easy, but the puzzles get a little unclear for some levels.  A great thing is there appears to be more than one way to solve a good number of these levels.  The R18 version has miscellaneous torture obstacles around which are easy to avoid if you know they're there, and easy to escape, but it does drain your health gradually.

Over all, nothing is too challenging platforming wise, except for a few sections where axes swing with the path your traveling.

Story: It's a nice story that really made me think.  There's two different endings, and the true ending makes a statement, if you're into that.  It's like old games where there's not that much story, but it's a really small game so I felt it fit.

The downsides.  It's not cute.  This is a game for sadists.  It's got bondage, abuse, and molestation throughout.  More so in the R18 version.

It's an easy achievement game though, so there's that.

reviewText: Cinderella Escape! R12 is a puzzle game starring Cinderella herself!  Through a series of unfortunate events, Cinderella finds herself prisoner, and must escape many dungeons, as well as free other prisoners, though the later objective is optional.  The story is very basic, and you're almost immediately thrust into the gameplay from the get go.  The goal of the game is to make your way out of each dungeon by finding a door.  While this would be simple, your task is made much harder due to the fact that you are limited to a certain number of jumps and kicks.  You can move blocks, to jump to places you need to go, or kick and destroy them if they're hindering your progress.  The earlier levels can be completed rather quickly, but the farther you make your way through the game, it becomes surprisingly difficult.  That said, I'm sure some people will be able to solve these puzzles more quickly than others, as there seem to be multiple ways to do so, and some will make you slap your forehead for not thinking of the answer sooner.  Also, while the environmental graphics are very basic, almost subpar, the character designs  look good.  Nothing to write home about, but I liked the artistic style, which kind of reminded me of RWBY.  At the end of the day, this is a somewhat challenging puzzle game with a almost non existent story that you'll spend 1 - 5 hours on depending on your skill level, but it's still an ok game.  Do I recommend it?  If you can pick it up for a couple of dollars, why not?  Oh but word to the wise, if you are using a game controller (ps4 controller in my case), you may experience out of control camera spinning when you first start the game.  To solve this problem, simply disconnect your controller, and use the keyboard!

reviewText: Cinderella Escape! R12 is a puzzle game where you control a nearly naked female character running here and there to push the boxes or kick to break them. You can jump on them so you can push or kick and break more boxes until you find the exit. There are also traps like spikes coming up through the floor, saw blades shooting out from a slit in the wall and blades swinging on pendulums. If you run into a guard, don't dispare, just let him have his way. The level design is terrible, the controls are horrible and the graphics are meh. There is very little story except for the beginning and the end, nothing inbetween. There is nothing about this game thats appealing, except maybe to horny little boys.

reviewText:
This game is a puzzle-based game with a tinge of eroge, well more on the bondage and torture part. However, due to Steam regulations, the one here is the R12 version, not the R18. There's not much difference between the two, except the R18 have the secret chamber, where you can torture Cinderella for your viewing pleasure (and I DO mean pleasure), and additional costumes.

Gameplay wise, its a basic puzzle solving game. Move blocks here and there to create a pathway to reach your goal. At certain points (end of sub-level), you will get a bonus objective of rescuing your step-relatives from being tortured, but the catch is that you will be tortured in their place. Don't worry, you can escape from it. You can change the camera angle and view perspective to see where is the goal of the map. This is really much needed, as sometimes it may be obscured by obstacle.

As for the difficulty, its pretty inconsistent. Some maps are pretty straight forward, while some require some retries to solve it. However, I cannot help but being shocked about a certain map, where all you need to do to reach a goal is a curve jump. Yes, you heard me correctly, a curve jump. No block moving, no obstacle dodging, no block demolishing, nothing else. Just a curve jump. It's a fast way for grinding money though. There was that one map though, where you actually need to get hit by the obstacle to reach the secondary objective. That was pretty interesting to me.

Everytime you solve a map, you will get money and experience. The higher level you are, the more chances you are provided with jumping and kicking. They are not limited, they are finite, and once you run out of them, poor Cinderella can't even jump at all, or even kick. Kind of a hinderance, but at the same time its a challenge to use them wisely. You can spend money on just costumes. So poor Cinderella can be dressed as a gothic dominatrix, bunny girl, Santa girl etc. Nothing much here but fanservice .

Since it's an eroge game, there are a lot of boob juggling physics and pantsu shots, since camera angle can be changed, as they are required to solve a map. Upskirts will be pretty common, heck sometimes I do that for fun. The biggest perk of this game is that, it's really cheap. It cost as much as a cheap lunch. It's not a very pricey game.

Overall, a short and cheap puzzle game which can be solved in a matter of hours. If you want some fun doing puzzles (and enjoy the T & A at the same time), go ahead, give this game a shot, since it's really cheap, there's nothing much to lose. Mind you this is the censored version. For the uncensored one, please check the Steam community forums for this game.

reviewText: I will not say that this was an excellent game. I will not even say that it was a great game, but I will say it was a -good- game. It could've been a hell of a lot worse, honestly. For the low price, you're paying for...Maybe two or three hours of puzzles, with some eye candy. The story is sparse, the puzzles range from absurdly easy to mildly challenging, and hey, if you're into damsels in bondage...Well, there ya go. Easy to patch in the R18 version, though don't expect hardcore pornography, you're only getting a few extra costumes and minor suggestive content. The end might be a letdown, depending on your actions. In the end, if you're going to get it, don't get it if you're here for Teh Bewbz and S3X"
date: because you'll be disappointed. Get it if you want a time-killer and an interesting take on puzzle-solving. I know I had at least two or three stages I planned out in two or three different fashions. 5/10. Would like to see more like this
recommended: but maybe with a bit more effort."
voteText: true

reviewText:
You know The Room? Not the game that I've seen floating around Steam somewhere, the Tommy Wiseau film. How The Room is so bad it's good? That's this game. I eagerly bought this game after seeing it in a Youtube video. My thoughts after the video was that this game seems so bad it's enjoyable. I was completely right.

Oh my god, where do I start to describe this? The first thing I should mention is that if there are any clearly much better games you have been thinking about getting, get them first. This is a game that you should only get if your library is already pretty much full with every game you want. If you're kind of bored of your 10,000th hour of Fallout 4 and don't mind spending five bucks on some stupid thing for a few hours, if just to wallow in it's campiness.

One of the first things you notice in the gameplay is the absolutely ridiculous jiggle physics. They're like Jell-o. Her ♥♥♥♥ bounce wildly at the slightest movement. It's too ludicrous to be sexy, but that's what makes it hilarious. Also, when EVERY female character (all four or five of them, but there's maybe seven characters total) dresses in ridiculously revealing outfits with the same jiggle physics, that just adds to the humor factor.

The story, I can infer was originally in Japanese then translated into English, has good 'ol Engrish. It's dumb and you've probably seen plenty of examples of Engrish already, it's always good for a cheap, unintentional laugh. The story, from what I could piece together, fit the engrish pretty well in the fact that it's bad but unintentionally funny, too. The best way I could describe it is that it's like a bad creepypasta.

The gameplay, I can't tell if it's genius or lazy. One thing I noticed was that I would often get distracted by fairly large areas of the level, that turned out to be completely useless. Sometimes this seems to be the result of lazy copy/pasting, sometimes this seems intentional. There's a level where it looks like you're supposed to use blocks to fill in gaps to allow a tall pillar to be pushed around the square bit in the center, but you're actually just supposed to move it in the hole a little to the right. It's the opposite approach of Portal, where very little serves no purpose. When I figured out that puzzle, I felt a similar level of satisfaction as when I solved Portal's puzzles for the first time. Then there's late-game puzzles where you can solve the puzzle by falling into the door. Things like that make me feel like the earlier puzzles were a case of accidental genius.

If you've been wondering about the R12 part of the title, it's a rating. It means for people 12 years or older. Basically the T rating we use in The United States. There is an R18 version you can easily find with a Google search. The only differences are that there are bondage versions of some outfits and a room filled with fetish-y torture devices and knights in armor that awkwardly dry hump you in a few positions. Don't bother unless you're morbidly curious.

TL:DR Get it if you like the film The Room and have nothing more interesting in the Steam store to play. Prepare to have a good time laughing and cringing at it.

reviewText:
A Fairytale with a not so happy ending...
Cinderella Escape! R12 is a clever, kinky and interesting twist on the Cinderella storybook. Her Prince Charming is not as charming as you might think!  Cinderella must climb, kick, push, pull and intelligently make use of her limited resources to complete each puzzling conundrum within the prince's dungeon.

Story:
Once upon a time, there was a girl named Cinderella. She was very beautiful and she was kind to all.
However, her stepmother didn't like her one little bit and treated her as a slave.

One day a letter with an invitation arrived. The letter explained that a ball was to be held at the palace and the Prince would choose a girl to become his wife.

She made every effort to get rid of all troubles to go to the ball.

She was on her way to the ball, when she witnessed the Prince killing his father, the King, in order to usurp the throne.
The Prince quickly claimed that Cinderella had killed the King andCinderella was arrested and locked in the deepest, darkest part of the dungeon...
Can she escape from the dungeon?
Will Cinderella have a happy ending?
Only by solving and navigating the dungeons deadly traps with help from her fairy god mother, will she ever see the light of day again...


Gameplay:
Cinderella Escape! is a 3D Action Puzzle Game.
Each puzzle requires use of the 3 main actions to solve the Puzzle and reach the exit.

Cinderella Escape makes good use of RPG elements such as the level up system to allow for the player to increase the amount of jumps and kicks required to complete the dungeon floor.

Gold can be earned in different stages of the game and used to purchase kinky costumes and extra content in a similar way to Blade Kitten.

The puzzles vary from easy to mindbendingly hard while still being fair and completable in your first run through the stage. The game made me think twice before solving it, as one wrong move could send poor Cinderella into a pit of spikes...

The R18+ Patch, which is not available on steam only adds some removed kinky content, but it is not required at all to enjoy the game.  In fact, I'd recommend not installing the R18 patch, as it doesnt add anything beyond asthetic changes.


Art style and models:
The art is in an anime-esque style that is well done and is reasonably suited to a game like this.
The main character is beautifully colored, animated, textured and has a hand drawn look.
The cutscenes are well animated with very few major problems across the board.

The only complaint I've got with the game is that the translation is not as gorgeous as the art that accompanies it.
The script is full of translation errors and some characters feel like their speech isnt as fluid as other anime based games.


Conclusion:
Cinderella Escape! R12 is an entertaining game full of kinky looking fairytale figures, a twist on the original story and unique puzzle concepts.

Despite being nowhere near the end, I'd imagine this fairytale does not have a happy ending...
But thats what appeals about these fairytale games, sometimes, things are not what they seem.

I'd highly recommend this version to anyone who does not mind a little bit of kinky imagery and a few translation issues.
All up this is a interesting game that is made better by its most recent controller patch.

Score:
10/10

reviewText:
I didn't know what to expect when I got this title. I figured that it wasn't your typical point and click escape game, which it isn't. The major difference between this and most escape games (besides the obvious S&M theme) is that this is more of a puzzler game.

You move about in real-time in stages that are grouped to similar builds and have to first find the exit of each stage and then figure out how to get there. There can be multiple ways of accomplishing stages if you are clever.

The character also has a linear level progression giving you more amounts of jumps (to elevate or cross) and kicks (to destroy blocks) that you can do as well as building HP to take damage from traps.

I'm pretty neutral about this game. It took me a little over 3 hours to get through. Ultimately I gave a thumbs up for the bewbs.
